00040 /**
00041  * @file
00042  *
00043  * Helper functions for PKI
00044  */
00045 
00046 #ifndef __CVMX_HELPER_PKI_H__
00047 #define __CVMX_HELPER_PKI_H__
00048 
00049 #ifdef CVMX_BUILD_FOR_LINUX_KERNEL
00050 #include <asm/octeon/cvmx.h>
00051 #include <asm/octeon/cvmx-pki.h>
00052 #else
00053 #include "cvmx-pki.h"
00054 #endif
00055 
00056 #ifdef __cplusplus
00057 /* *INDENT-OFF* */
00058 extern "C" {
00059 /* *INDENT-ON* */
00060 #endif
00061 
00062 /* Modify this if more than 8 ilk channels need to be supported */
00063 #define CVMX_MAX_PORT_PER_INTERFACE 64
00064 #define CVMX_MAX_QOS_PRIORITY       64
00065 #define CVMX_PKI_FIND_AVAILABLE_RSRC    (-1)
00066 
00067 struct cvmx_pki_qos_schd {
00068     cvmx_fpa3_gaura_t _aura;    /* FPA3 AURA handle */
00069     cvmx_fpa3_pool_t _pool; /* FPA3 POOL handle */
00070     bool pool_per_qos;  /* This qos priority will use its own pool, if FALSE use port pool */
00071     int pool_num;       /* pool number to use, if -1 allocated by sdk otherwise software should alloc it */
00072     char *pool_name;
00073     uint64_t pool_buff_size;/* size of buffer in pool , if this priority is using its own pool*/
00074                 /* it's good to have same buffer size if qos are using separate pools */
00075     uint64_t pool_max_buff; /* number of max buffers allowed in the pool, if this priority is using its own pool*/
00076     bool aura_per_qos;  /* This qos priority will use its own aura, if FALSE use port aura */
00077     int aura_num;       /* aura number to use, if -1 allocated by sdk otherwise software should alloc it */
00078     char *aura_name;
00079     uint64_t aura_buff_cnt; /* number of buffers in aura, if this priority is using its own aura*/
00080     bool sso_grp_per_qos;   /* This qos priority will use its own group, if FALSE use port group */
00081     int sso_grp;        /* group number to use, if -1 allocated by sdk otherwise software should alloc it */
00082     uint16_t port_add;      /* for BGX super MAC ports which wants to have PFC enabled */
00083     int qpg_base;           /* offset in qpg table to use, if -1 allocated by sdk otherwise software should alloc it*/
00084 };
00085 
00086 struct cvmx_pki_prt_schd {
00087     cvmx_fpa3_pool_t _pool; /* FPA3 POOL handle */
00088     cvmx_fpa3_gaura_t _aura;/* FPA3 AURA handle */
00089     bool cfg_port;          /* Set to 1 if this port on the interface is not used */
00090     int style;              /* If port is using its own style and not interface style */
00091     bool pool_per_prt;  /* Port will use its own pool, if FALSE use interface pool */
00092     int pool_num;       /* pool number to use, if -1 allocated by sdk otherwise software should alloc it*/
00093     char *pool_name;
00094     uint64_t pool_buff_size;/*size of buffer in pool , if this port is using its own pool*/
00095             /* it's good to have same buffer size if ports are using same style but different pools*/
00096     uint64_t pool_max_buff; /* number of max buffers allowed in the pool, if this port is using its own pool*/
00097     bool aura_per_prt;  /* port will use its own aura, if FALSE use interface aura */
00098     int aura_num;       /* aura number to use, if -1 allocated by sdk otherwise software should alloc it */
00099     char *aura_name;
00100     uint64_t aura_buff_cnt; /* number of buffers in aura, if this pool is using its own aura*/
00101     bool sso_grp_per_prt;   /* port will use its own sso group, if FALSE use interface group*/
00102     int sso_grp;        /* sso group number to use, if -1 allocated by sdk otherwise software should alloc it */
00103     enum cvmx_pki_qpg_qos qpg_qos;
00104     int qpg_base;           /* offset in qpg table to use, if -1 allocated by sdk otherwise software should alloc it*/
00105     struct cvmx_pki_qos_schd qos_s[CVMX_MAX_QOS_PRIORITY];
00106 };
00107 
00108 struct cvmx_pki_intf_schd {
00109     cvmx_fpa3_pool_t _pool; /* FPA3 POOL handle */
00110     cvmx_fpa3_gaura_t _aura;/* FPA3 AURA handle */
00111     bool style_per_intf;    /* 1: all ports on this interface will use same style; 0:ports on this intf will use their own style */
00112     int style;              /* style number to use, if -1 allocated by sdk otherwise software should alloc it*/
00113     bool pool_per_intf;     /* Ports will use either this shared pool or their own pool*/
00114     int pool_num;       /* pool number to use, if -1 allocated by sdk otherwise software should alloc it*/
00115     char *pool_name;
00116     uint64_t pool_buff_size;
00117     uint64_t pool_max_buff;
00118     bool aura_per_intf;     /* Ports will use either this shared aura or their own aura */
00119     int aura_num;       /* aura number to use, if -1 allocated by sdk otherwise software should alloc it*/
00120     char *aura_name;
00121     uint64_t aura_buff_cnt;
00122     bool sso_grp_per_intf;  /* Ports will use either this shared group or their own aura */
00123     int sso_grp;        /* sso group number to use, if -1 allocated by sdk otherwise software should alloc it */
00124     bool qos_share_aura;    /* All ports share the same aura for respective qos if qpg_qos used*/
00125     bool qos_share_grp;     /* All ports share the same sso group for respective qos if qps qos used*/
00126     int qpg_base;           /* offset in qpg table to use, if -1 allocated by sdk otherwise software should alloc it*/
00127     struct cvmx_pki_prt_schd prt_s[CVMX_MAX_PORT_PER_INTERFACE];
00128 };
00129 
00130 struct cvmx_pki_global_schd {
00131     bool setup_pool;
00132     int pool_num;              /* pool number to use, if -1 allocated by sdk otherwise software should alloc it*/
00133     char *pool_name;
00134     uint64_t pool_buff_size;
00135     uint64_t pool_max_buff;
00136     bool setup_aura;
00137     int aura_num;              /* aura number to use, if -1 allocated by sdk otherwise software should alloc it*/
00138     char *aura_name;
00139     uint64_t aura_buff_cnt;
00140     bool setup_sso_grp;
00141     int sso_grp;            /* sso group number to use, if -1 allocated by sdk otherwise software should alloc it */
00142     cvmx_fpa3_pool_t _pool;
00143     cvmx_fpa3_gaura_t _aura;
00144 };
00145 
00146 struct cvmx_pki_legacy_qos_watcher {
00147     bool configured;
00148     enum cvmx_pki_term field;
00149     uint32_t data;
00150     uint32_t data_mask;
00151     uint8_t advance;
00152     uint8_t sso_grp;
00153 };

00155 extern CVMX_SHARED bool cvmx_pki_dflt_init[CVMX_MAX_NODES];
00156 
00157 extern CVMX_SHARED struct cvmx_pki_pool_config pki_dflt_pool[CVMX_MAX_NODES];
00158 extern CVMX_SHARED struct cvmx_pki_aura_config pki_dflt_aura[CVMX_MAX_NODES];
00159 extern CVMX_SHARED struct cvmx_pki_style_config pki_dflt_style[CVMX_MAX_NODES];
00160 extern CVMX_SHARED struct cvmx_pki_pkind_config pki_dflt_pkind[CVMX_MAX_NODES];
00161 extern CVMX_SHARED uint64_t pkind_style_map[CVMX_MAX_NODES][CVMX_PKI_NUM_PKIND];
00162 extern CVMX_SHARED struct cvmx_pki_sso_grp_config pki_dflt_sso_grp[CVMX_MAX_NODES];
00163 extern CVMX_SHARED struct cvmx_pki_legacy_qos_watcher qos_watcher[8];
00164 
00165 /**
00166  * This function Enabled the PKI hardware to
00167  * start accepting/processing packets.
00168  * @param node    node number
00169  */
00170 void cvmx_helper_pki_enable(int node);
00171 
00172 /**
00173  * This function frees up PKI resources consumed by that port.
00174  * This function should only be called if port resources
00175  * (fpa pools aura, style qpg entry pcam entry etc.) are not shared
00176  * @param xipd_port     ipd port number for which resources need to
00177  *                      be freed.
00178  */
00179 int cvmx_helper_pki_port_shutdown(int xipd_port);
00180 
00181 /**
00182  * This function shuts down complete PKI hardware
00183  * and software resources.
00184  * @param node          node number where PKI needs to shutdown.
00185  */
00186 void cvmx_helper_pki_shutdown(int node);
00187 
00188 /**
00189  * This function calculates how mant qpf entries will be needed for
00190  * a particular QOS.
00191  * @param qpg_qos       qos value for which entries need to be calculated.
00192  */
00193 int cvmx_helper_pki_get_num_qpg_entry(enum cvmx_pki_qpg_qos qpg_qos);
00194 
00195 /**
00196  * This function setups the qos table by allocating qpg entry and writing
00197  * the provided parameters to that entry (offset).
00198  * @param node          node number.
00199  * @param qpg_cfg       pointer to struct containing qpg configuration
00200  */
00201 int cvmx_helper_pki_set_qpg_entry(int node, struct cvmx_pki_qpg_config *qpg_cfg);
00202 
00203 /**
00204  * This function sets up aura QOS for RED, backpressure and tail-drop.
00205  *
00206  * @param node       node number.
00207  * @param aura       aura to configure.
00208  * @param ena_red       enable RED based on [DROP] and [PASS] levels
00209  *          1: enable 0:disable
00210  * @param pass_thresh   pass threshold for RED.
00211  * @param drop_thresh   drop threshold for RED
00212  * @param ena_bp        enable backpressure based on [BP] level.
00213  *          1:enable 0:disable
00214  * @param bp_thresh     backpressure threshold.
00215  * @param ena_drop      enable tail drop.
00216  *          1:enable 0:disable
00217  * @return Zero on success. Negative on failure
00218  */
00219 int cvmx_helper_setup_aura_qos(int node, int aura, bool ena_red, bool ena_drop,
00220     uint64_t pass_thresh, uint64_t drop_thresh,
00221     bool ena_bp, uint64_t bp_thresh);
00222 
00223 /**
00224  * This function maps specified bpid to all the auras from which it can receive bp and
00225  * then maps that bpid to all the channels, that bpid can asserrt bp on.
00226  *
00227  * @param node          node number.
00228  * @param aura          aura number which will back pressure specified bpid.
00229  * @param bpid          bpid to map.
00230  * @param chl_map       array of channels to map to that bpid.
00231  * @param chl_cnt   number of channel/ports to map to that bpid.
00232  * @return Zero on success. Negative on failure
00233  */
00234 int cvmx_helper_pki_map_aura_chl_bpid(int node, uint16_t aura, uint16_t bpid,
00235         uint16_t chl_map[], uint16_t chl_cnt);
00236 
00237 /**
00238  * This function sets up the global pool, aura and sso group
00239  * resources which application can use between any interfaces
00240  * and ports.
00241  * @param node          node number
00242  * @param gblsch        pointer to struct containing global
00243  *                      scheduling parameters.
00244  */
00245 int cvmx_helper_pki_set_gbl_schd(int node, struct cvmx_pki_global_schd *gblsch);
00246 
00247 /**
00248  * This function sets up scheduling parameters (pool, aura, sso group etc)
00249  * of an ipd port.
00250  * @param xipd_port     ipd port number
00251  * @param prtsch        pointer to struct containing port's
00252  *                      scheduling parameters.
00253  */
00254 int cvmx_helper_pki_init_port(int xipd_port, struct cvmx_pki_prt_schd *prtsch);
00255 
00256 /**
00257  * This function sets up scheduling parameters (pool, aura, sso group etc)
00258  * of an interface (all ports/channels on that interface).
00259  * @param xiface        interface number with node.
00260  * @param intfsch      pointer to struct containing interface
00261  *                      scheduling parameters.
00262  * @param gblsch       pointer to struct containing global scheduling parameters
00263  *                      (can be NULL if not used)
00264  */
00265 int cvmx_helper_pki_init_interface(const int xiface,
00266     struct cvmx_pki_intf_schd *intfsch,
00267     struct cvmx_pki_global_schd *gblsch);
00268 /**
00269  * This function gets all the PKI parameters related to that
00270  * particular port from hardware.
00271  * @param xipd_port     ipd port number to get parameter of
00272  * @param port_cfg      pointer to structure where to store read parameters
00273  */
00274 void cvmx_pki_get_port_config(int xipd_port, struct cvmx_pki_port_config *port_cfg);
00275 
00276 /**
00277  * This function sets all the PKI parameters related to that
00278  * particular port in hardware.
00279  * @param xipd_port     ipd port number to get parameter of
00280  * @param port_cfg      pointer to structure containing port parameters
00281  */
00282 void cvmx_pki_set_port_config(int xipd_port, struct cvmx_pki_port_config *port_cfg);
00283 
00284 /**
00285  * This function displays all the PKI parameters related to that
00286  * particular port.
00287  * @param xipd_port      ipd port number to display parameter of
00288  */
00289 void cvmx_pki_show_port_config(int xipd_port);
00290 
00291 /**
00292  * Modifies maximum frame length to check.
00293  * It modifies the global frame length set used by this port, any other
00294  * port using the same set will get affected too.
00295  * @param xipd_port ipd port for which to modify max len.
00296  * @param max_size  maximum frame length
00297  */
00298 void cvmx_pki_set_max_frm_len(int xipd_port, uint32_t max_size);
00299 
00300 /**
00301  * This function sets up all the ports of particular interface
00302  * for chosen fcs mode. (only use for backward compatibility).
00303  * New application can control it via init_interface calls.
00304  * @param node          node number.
00305  * @param interface     interface number.
00306  * @param nports        number of ports
00307  * @param has_fcs       1 -- enable fcs check and fcs strip.
00308  *                      0 -- disable fcs check.
00309  */
00310 void cvmx_helper_pki_set_fcs_op(int node, int interface, int nports, int has_fcs);
00311 
00312 /**
00313  * This function sets the wqe buffer mode of all ports. First packet data buffer can reside
00314  * either in same buffer as wqe OR it can go in separate buffer. If used the later mode,
00315  * make sure software allocate enough buffers to now have wqe separate from packet data.
00316  * @param node                  node number.
00317  * @param pkt_outside_wqe   0 = The packet link pointer will be at word [FIRST_SKIP]
00318  *                  immediately followed by packet data, in the same buffer
00319  *                  as the work queue entry.
00320  *              1 = The packet link pointer will be at word [FIRST_SKIP] in a new
00321  *                  buffer separate from the work queue entry. Words following the
00322  *                  WQE in the same cache line will be zeroed, other lines in the
00323  *                  buffer will not be modified and will retain stale data (from the
00324  *                  buffers previous use). This setting may decrease the peak PKI
00325  *                  performance by up to half on small packets.
00326  */
00327 void cvmx_helper_pki_set_wqe_mode(int node, bool pkt_outside_wqe);
00328 
00329 /**
00330  * This function sets the Packet mode of all ports and styles to little-endian.
00331  * It Changes write operations of packet data to L2C to
00332  * be in little-endian. Does not change the WQE header format, which is
00333  * properly endian neutral.
00334  * @param node                  node number.
00335  */
00336 void cvmx_helper_pki_set_little_endian(int node);
00337

00341                    int pool, int buffer_count);
00342 void cvmx_helper_pki_set_dflt_pool_buffer(int node, int buffer_count);
00343 
00344 void cvmx_helper_pki_set_dflt_aura_buffer(int node, int buffer_count);
00345 
00346 void cvmx_helper_pki_set_dflt_pkind_map(int node, int pkind, int style);
00347 
00348 void cvmx_helper_pki_get_dflt_style(int node, struct cvmx_pki_style_config *style_cfg);
00349 
00350 void cvmx_helper_pki_set_dflt_style(int node, struct cvmx_pki_style_config *style_cfg);
00351 
00352 void cvmx_helper_pki_no_dflt_init(int node);
